text.original: Per causam sui intelligo id, cujus essentia involvit existentiam, sive id, cujus natura non potest concipi, nisi existens.
text.translation: By cause of itself I understand that whose essence involves existence; or that whose nature cannot be conceived except as existing.

logic.notes: Captures the necessity of existence from essence.

sources: Latin text based on Gebhardt; online Latin via The Latin Library (https://www.thelatinlibrary.com/spinoza.ethica1.html)
English translation by R.H.M. Elwes as hosted at Marxists Internet Archive (https://www.marxists.org/reference/subject/philosophy/works/ne/ethics.htm)

label: Definition of Finite in its Kind

text.original: Dicitur res alicujus rei finita suo genere, quando aliâ ejusdem naturæ potest terminari.
text.translation: A thing is called finite after its kind when it can be limited by another of the same nature.

sources: Latin text based on Gebhardt; online Latin via The Latin Library (https://www.thelatinlibrary.com/spinoza.ethica1.html)
English translation by R.H.M. Elwes as hosted at Marxists Internet Archive (https://www.marxists.org/reference/subject/philosophy/works/ne/ethics.htm)

label: Everything which exists, exists either in itself or in something else

text.original: Omnia, quæ sunt, vel in se, vel in alio sunt.
text.translation: Everything which exists, exists either in itself or in something else.

sources: Latin text based on Gebhardt; online Latin via The Latin Library (https://www.thelatinlibrary.com/spinoza.ethica1.html)
English translation by R.H.M. Elwes as hosted at Marxists Internet Archive (https://www.marxists.org/reference/subject/philosophy/works/ne/ethics.htm)

label: Substance is prior in nature to its affections

text.original: Substantia prior est naturâ suis affectionibus.
text.translation: Substance is by nature prior to its affections.

logic.notes: Simplified dependency of modes on substance.

proof.sketch: Modes depend on substance to exist; therefore substance is ontologically prior.

sources: Latin text based on Gebhardt; online Latin via The Latin Library (https://www.thelatinlibrary.com/spinoza.ethica1.html)
English translation by R.H.M. Elwes as hosted at Marxists Internet Archive (https://www.marxists.org/reference/subject/philosophy/works/ne/ethics.htm)
